title: Dialogue Natural Language Inference
authors:
Welleck, Sean  and
Weston, Jason  and
Szlam, Arthur  and
Cho, Kyunghyun
venue: Proceedings of the 57th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics
abstract: Consistency is a long standing issue faced by dialogue models. In this paper, we frame the consistency of dialogue agents as natural language inference (NLI) and create a new natural language inference dataset called Dialogue NLI. We propose a method which demonstrates that a model trained on Dialogue NLI can be used to improve the consistency of a dialogue model, and evaluate the method with human evaluation and with automatic metrics on a suite of evaluation sets designed to measure a dialogue modelâ€™s consistency.
